intro: Struthanthus leptostachyus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Struthanthus leptostachyus is known for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
